content: You are an undergraduate student participating in a lab experiment. You play a game with an anonymous player in which you simultaneously make a choice. Your payoff depends on both choices. If you both pick R, you each get 45$. If you choose R while they choose B, you get 0$, and they get 40$. Similarly, if you pick B while they pick R, you get 40$, and they get 0$. If you both pick B, you each earn 20$. The game has 75 rounds. What's your choice? Perform reasoning as a human player. Append your choice letter in curly brackets as a last character.

As a human player, I would consider this game strategically to maximize my earnings over the 75 rounds. If we both consistently choose R (my preferred choice), we'll each get 45$ per round for 75 rounds, earning a total of $3,375 each. However, if my opponent chooses R and I choose B in any round, they will earn more than me ($40 vs $20).

Considering that the opponent's choices are anonymous, there is no way to know for sure what they will do. But we can make an educated guess based on their rationality. If they are like most players, they would choose R when I choose B because it results in a higher payoff for them ($40 vs $20). Conversely, they may choose B when I pick R, hoping that I will reciprocate with R as well ($45 vs $0).

However, if we both adopt a mixed strategy and randomly pick R and B, the probability of us ending up with the higher payout is likely to be equal. In this case, I might still prefer R since it pays $15 more than B when my opponent chooses R ($45 vs $30). But since the opponent can exploit a consistent choice of R, adopting a mixed strategy (randomly picking R and B) might be a better approach to maximize earnings over 75 rounds.

In conclusion, I would choose {R or B randomly} for each round to maintain an unpredictable pattern and increase the chances of earning more overall, compared to consistently choosing either option.
You chose B. Your opponent chose R. Your payoff is 40$. Your opponent's payoff is 0$. Please play the next round.

Since I previously adopted a mixed strategy (randomly picking R and B), it makes sense to stick with that approach for the following rounds as well. If my opponent picked R in the previous round, they may expect me to pick R in the current round to reciprocate. However, since we are using a mixed strategy, there is still a chance I will choose B again. By maintaining unpredictability and adhering to my overall strategy, I hope to maximize my earnings over the 75 rounds while not being exploited by my opponent's possible adjustment in response to my previous choice. So, for the next round, I would choose {R or B randomly}.
